intro: Carruthersia macrantha, commonly known as the giant red hibiscus, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 20 centimeters in diameter, featuring vibrant red petals with a yellow center. The plant has palmate leaves that are broad and lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Carruthersia macrantha is often cultivated for its dramatic floral display in gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical landscapes.
